intro: Reseda jacquinii subsp. jacquinii, commonly known as yellow catchfly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are typically oval-shaped with serrated edges. Native to regions of Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in disturbed soils and sunny habitats. It is often found in meadows, roadsides, and other open areas where it can establish itself readily.
